text: France was represented by five-member group Profil, with the song '"Hé, hé, m'sieurs dames", at the 1980 Eurovision Song Contest, which took place on 19 April in The Hague. ==Before Eurovision== === National final === Having chosen their 1979 entry by internal selection, broadcaster TF1 returned to a public selection using the same format as in 1976-1978, with two semi-finals followed by the final on 23 March 1980. ==== Semi-finals ==== Each semi-final contained seven songs, with the top three in each going forward to the final. The qualifiers were chosen by public televoting. Other participants included 1969 contest winner Frida Boccara and Minouche Barelli, who had represented Monaco in 1967.National Finals database 1980 Semis ====Semi-final 1==== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto; text- align:center" ! colspan="5" |Semi-final 1 – 9 March 1980 |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! Draw ! Artist ! Song ! Televote ! Place |- |1 | align="left" |Jocelyne Jocya | align="left" |"Si tous les "je t'aime" | 1,143 | 6 |- | 2 | align="left" |Serge Fouchet | align="left" |"Le jour de la liberté" | 597 | 7 |- |3 | align="left" |Michel Démétriadès | align="left" |"On a coupé un arbre" | 2,056 | 4 |- style="font-weight:bold;background:navajowhite;" |4 | align="left" |Bee Michelin | align="left" |"Une chanson rose" | 5,091 | 2 |- style="font- weight:bold;background:navajowhite;" |5 | align="left" |Frida Boccara | align="left" |"Un enfant de France" | 4,722 | 3 |- |6 | align="left" |Nadine Douteau | align="left" |"Ils ont plantés un olivier" | 1,441 | 5 |- style="font-weight:bold;background:navajowhite;" |7 | align="left" |Marcel Amont | align="left" |"Camarade vigneron" | 5,902 | 1 |} ====Semi-final 2==== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto; text- align:center" ! colspan="5" |Semi-final 2 – 16 March 1980 |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! Draw ! Artist ! Song ! Televote ! Place |- |1 | align="left" |Minouche Barelli | align="left" |"Viens dans ma farandole" | 1,705 | 6 |- style="font- weight:bold;background:navajowhite;" | 2 | align="left" |Chantal Billon | align="left" |"Un jour, un matin" | 6,107 | 1 |- |3 | align="left" |Parasol | align="left" |"Ni bleu, ni gris" | 1,919 | 5 |- style="font- weight:bold;background:navajowhite;" |4 | align="left" |Profil | align="left" |"Hé, hé, m'sieurs dames" | 6,049 | 2 |- |5 | align="left" |Simone Langlois | align="left" |"Dans le regard d'un enfant" | 3,094 | 4 |- |6 | align="left" |Bernard Sauvat | align="left" |"J'suis heureux" | 1,493 | 7 |- style="font- weight:bold;background:navajowhite;" |7 | align="left" |Anne Delorme | align="left" |"Poète ou musicien" | 5,803 | 3 |} ===Final=== The final took place on 23 March 1980, hosted by Évelyne Dhéliat. The winner was chosen by public televoting.ESC National Finals database 1980 {| class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto; text-align:center" ! colspan="5" |Final – 23 March 1980 |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! Draw ! Artist ! Song ! Televote ! Place |- |1 | align="left" |Bee Michelin | align="left" |"Une chanson rose" |4,071 |6 |- | 2 | align="left" |Chantal Billon | align="left" |"Un jour, un matin" | 8,263 |2 |- |3 | align="left" |Anne Delorme | align="left" |"Poète ou musicien" |7,324 |3 |- style="font-weight:bold; background:gold;" |4 | align="left" |Profil | align="left" |"Hé, hé, m'sieurs dames" |10,628 |1 |- |5 | align="left" |Marcel Amont | align="left" |Camarade vigneron |7,182 |4 |- |6 | align="left" |Frida Boccara | align="left" |"Un enfant de France" |7,144 |5 |} == At Eurovision == On the night of the final Profil performed 16th in the running order, following the Netherlands and preceding eventual contest winners Ireland. "Hé, hé, m'sieurs dames" was a rare French venture into uptempo disposable pop, but did not prove to have great appeal as at the close of voting it had picked up 45 points, placing France 11th of the 19 entries and bringing to an end a run of four consecutive top 3 finishes. The French jury awarded its 12 points to the Netherlands.ESC History - France 1980 {| class="wikitable" |- |+Points awarded to France |- !width=20%|12 points !width=20%|10 points !width=20%|8 points !width=20%|7 points !width=20%|6 points |- | valign="top" | | valign="top" | | valign="top" | | valign="top" | * | valign="top" | * |- !width=20%|5 points !width=20%|4 points !width=20%|3 points !width=20%|2 points !width=20%|1 point |- | valign="top" | * * | valign="top" | * * | valign="top" | * * * | valign="top" | * | valign="top" | * * * |- |} {| class="wikitable" |- |+Points awarded by France |- |width=20% bgcolor="gold"|12 points|| |- |width=20% bgcolor="silver"|10 points|| |- |width=20% bgcolor="#CC9966"|8 points|| |- |width=20%|7 points|| |- |width=20%|6 points|| |- |width=20%|5 points|| |- |width=20%|4 points|| |- |width=20%|3 points|| |- |width=20%|2 points|| |- |width=20%|1 point|| |- |} ==See also== *France in the Eurovision Song Contest *Eurovision Song Contest 1980 == References == Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1980 Category:France in the Eurovision Song Contest Category:1980 in French music
